column5: is there a slot size for Lake Simcoe Walleye? I want to fish for them tonight and was just wondering.
Yes. Here you go. Click zone 16 http://www.mnr.gov.on.ca/en/Business/LetsF...L02_163615.html
S-4; not more than 1 greater than 46cm (18.1 in.) C-2; "                                                          "  You really should get a copy of the regs.

So what I understand is that I can keep a total of 4 walleye with one being over 18.1" .  That is cool so there is no real slot walleye that have to be thrown back unless you already have one over 18.1"
I hear a Simcoe walleye is a very elusive fish.  Good luck!
yepper, when they generalized the regs in a couple areas, that's the deal. For example, where my trailer is used to be 6 fish no slot, as of 2008 it's 4 with the same 18.1 fish in the mix
Theres been alot of acedental(sp?) catches here in the bay the last few years,and when you do get one,they are a good size. They seem to follow the crappie and perch that come in.

lol!  Yep A couple of tens recently from the shore.  THey are crushing smaller perch when the perch is caught and refuse to let go.  I am on my way out there tonight.  Should be nice and cold but I don't care.
You cant use perch for bait. ,L M A O Good luck to ya Cudz.

I know but if I catch a perch and reel him in really really slowly... lol.  Just kidding.  I bought a dozen medium minnow at Simcoe bait and Tackle at 4:45 this evening before they closed (she actually gave me about 18).  You are more than welcome to come.  I will be out there at about 9 pm.  It will be like ice fishing but without the ice.
ah that explains it. I had my little guys out a while back catching some dink perch on the scooby doo rod when one of the rods just bent over. We lost the fish, I just figured it had been a pike.
I've caught two in the bay .. ever.  But they were 7 and 9 pounds.
Fished from 9 pm until 11 pm.  Only caught a bunch of perch.  Lots of them there that is for sure.  Oh well, still got out fishing.
